page.title: 06COMMUNICATIONS
page.content:
OLD AGE PENSIONER OUTING FOR THE THIRD SUCCESSIVE YEAR MORE THAN 80 ELDERLY PEOPLE FROM BARNET AND THE SURROUNDING DISTRICT ENJOYED A SUNNY DAY OUT AT CLACTON-ON-SEA; ORGANISED BY THE PUDDLENECK SOCIETY. THEY STOPPED FOR A DRINK IN A PUB ON THE WAY,HAD LUNCH OVERLOOKING THE SEA FRONT AND AFTER A FREE AFTERNOON WENT BACK TO THE HOTEL FOR HIGH TEA. MORE THAN 100 PEOPLE INCLUDING HELPERS ENJOYED THE DAY.
Â£9000 RAID THIEVES NETTED Â£9000 WHEN THEY RAIDED A HOUSE IN BELLS HILL LAST WEEK. THE HAUL INCLUDED THREE TELEVISIONS,A VIDEO RECORDER,HI-FI EQUIPMENT,SILVER AND JEWELLERY. THE SIDE DOOR HAD BEEN FORCED. A POLICE CAR ANSWERING AN EMERGENCY WAS INVOLVED IN A COLLISION WITH A LEARNER DRIVER ON BARNET HILL.
